body:
During our Jenkins run, a cluster failed to initialize with a pattern like so:

```
Waiting for cluster initialization.

  This will continually check to see if the API for kubernetes is reachable.
  This might loop forever if there was some uncaught error during start
  up.

.......................Kubernetes cluster created.
current-context: ""
Running: /jenkins-master-data/jobs/kubernetes-e2e-gce/workspace/kubernetes/hack/e2e-internal/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../platforms/linux/amd64/kubectl config set-cluster kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins --server=https://146.148.54.192 --certificate-authority=/var/lib/jenkins/jobs/kubernetes-e2e-gce/workspace/.kube/kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins/kubernetes.ca.crt --global
current-context: ""
Running: /jenkins-master-data/jobs/kubernetes-e2e-gce/workspace/kubernetes/hack/e2e-internal/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../platforms/linux/amd64/kubectl config set-credentials kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins-admin --auth-path=/var/lib/jenkins/jobs/kubernetes-e2e-gce/workspace/.kube/kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins/kubernetes_auth --global
current-context: ""
Running: /jenkins-master-data/jobs/kubernetes-e2e-gce/workspace/kubernetes/hack/e2e-internal/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../platforms/linux/amd64/kubectl config set-context kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins --cluster=kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins --user=kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins-admin --global
current-context: ""
Running: /jenkins-master-data/jobs/kubernetes-e2e-gce/workspace/kubernetes/hack/e2e-internal/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../cluster/../cluster/gce/../../platforms/linux/amd64/kubectl config use-context kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins --global
Wrote /var/lib/jenkins/jobs/kubernetes-e2e-gce/workspace/.kube/kubernetes-jenkins_e2e-test-jenkins/kubernetes_auth
Sanity checking cluster...
Attempt 1 to check Docker on node e2e-test-jenkins-minion-0t3k ... [0;32m[working][0m
Attempt 1 to check Docker on node e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 ...
```

I logged into the second node to see what was going on, and found the kubelet logs seemed to be repeating themselves every couple of minutes:

```
I0311 18:00:36.149229    5616 server.go:329] Watching apiserver
I0311 18:00:36.150968    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/cadvisor.manifest": default.cadvisor-agent-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (539b5573073fb416c4943fa34aa1d813)
I0311 18:00:36.151701    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/fluentd-gcp.manifest": default.fluentd-to-gcp-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (cb4343fe02c5b3fdf4d3c6a277cf5c15)
I0311 18:00:56.153205    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/cadvisor.manifest": default.cadvisor-agent-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (539b5573073fb416c4943fa34aa1d813)
I0311 18:00:56.155224    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/fluentd-gcp.manifest": default.fluentd-to-gcp-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (cb4343fe02c5b3fdf4d3c6a277cf5c15)
I0311 18:01:16.156559    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/cadvisor.manifest": default.cadvisor-agent-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (539b5573073fb416c4943fa34aa1d813)
I0311 18:01:16.157086    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/fluentd-gcp.manifest": default.fluentd-to-gcp-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (cb4343fe02c5b3fdf4d3c6a277cf5c15)
I0311 18:01:36.158518    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/cadvisor.manifest": default.cadvisor-agent-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (539b5573073fb416c4943fa34aa1d813)
I0311 18:01:36.159168    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/fluentd-gcp.manifest": default.fluentd-to-gcp-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (cb4343fe02c5b3fdf4d3c6a277cf5c15)
I0311 18:01:56.160666    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/cadvisor.manifest": default.cadvisor-agent-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (539b5573073fb416c4943fa34aa1d813)
I0311 18:01:56.161282    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/fluentd-gcp.manifest": default.fluentd-to-gcp-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (cb4343fe02c5b3fdf4d3c6a277cf5c15)
I0311 18:02:16.162795    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/cadvisor.manifest": default.cadvisor-agent-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (539b5573073fb416c4943fa34aa1d813)
I0311 18:02:16.163565    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/fluentd-gcp.manifest": default.fluentd-to-gcp-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (cb4343fe02c5b3fdf4d3c6a277cf5c15)
I0311 18:02:36.165060    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/cadvisor.manifest": default.cadvisor-agent-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (539b5573073fb416c4943fa34aa1d813)
I0311 18:02:36.165626    5616 file.go:209] Got pod from file "/etc/kubernetes/manifests/fluentd-gcp.manifest": default.fluentd-to-gcp-e2e-test-jenkins-minion-kwe2 (cb4343fe02c5b3fdf4d3c6a277cf5c15)
I0311 18:02:36.256496    6116 server.go:149] Using root directory: /var/lib/kubelet
I0311 18:02:36.256574    6116 docker.go:798] Connecting to docker on unix:///var/run/docker.sock
I0311 18:02:36.257908    6116 util.go:40] Sending events to api server.
I0311 18:02:36.258010    6116 server.go:315] Adding manifest file: /etc/kubernetes/manifests
I0311 18:02:36.258027    6116 file.go:51] Watching path "/etc/kubernetes/manifests"
I0311 18:02:36.258039    6116 server.go:329] Watching apiserver
```

Checking monit, yup:

```
[UTC Mar 11 18:44:38] error    : 'kubelet' failed, cannot open a connection to INET[localhost:10250/healthz] via TCP
[UTC Mar 11 18:44:38] info     : 'kubelet' trying to restart
[UTC Mar 11 18:44:38] info     : 'kubelet' stop: /etc/init.d/kubelet
[UTC Mar 11 18:44:38] info     : 'kubelet' start: /etc/init.d/kubelet
[UTC Mar 11 18:46:38] error    : 'kubelet' failed, cannot open a connection to INET[localhost:10250/healthz] via TCP
[UTC Mar 11 18:46:38] info     : 'kubelet' trying to restart
[UTC Mar 11 18:46:38] info     : 'kubelet' stop: /etc/init.d/kubelet
[UTC Mar 11 18:46:38] info     : 'kubelet' start: /etc/init.d/kubelet
```

Jenkins is currently disabled to allow live debugging of the issue. Raising to P0 until we get Jenkins back.

cc @dchen1107 @ixdy

labels.description: Highest priority. Must be actively worked on as someone's top priority right now.
labels.name: priority/critical-urgent

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.
labels.name: sig/node

milestone.description: Issues that need to be resolved for v1.0 of Kubernetes.
milestone.title: v1.0

title: Detect and handle docker api unresponse issue
